gather.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to come together and form a group, or to make people do this
gather.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: A crowd gathered to watch the fight.
Thousands of people gathered outside the embassy.
Gather round, everyone, so that you can see the screen.
During the air raids, we gathered the children around us and sang songs.
Could the bride’s family all gather together for a photo?
Dozens of photographers were gathered outside Jagger’s villa.
gather.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard
gather.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: You two know each other, I gather.
She’s his niece, from what I can gather.
from what I can gather/as far as I can gather
I gather you’ve had some problems with our sales department.
gather.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to get things from different places and put them together in one place
gather.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The researcher’s job is to gather information about people.
They had gathered 440,000 signatures to support their demand.
gather.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to pull material into small folds
gather.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The skirt is gathered at the waist.
gather.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to pull material or a piece of clothing closer to you
gather.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Moira gathered her skirts round her and climbed the steps.
gather.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to gradually become more cloudy or get darker
gather.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Storm clouds were gathering so we hurried home.
gather.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a small fold produced by pulling cloth together
